attributes.action: Help remove the Bollards on Gosforth High Street, Newcastle upon Tyne NE3
attributes.background:
Bollards are aesthetically repulsive and make Gosforth look run down.
Bollards slow down traffic & contribute to air pollution.
Bollards block Emergency vehicles - cars use nearby roads as rat runs
Bollards are inconsistent & encourage jay walking
Bollards are extremely unpopular in surveys.
attributes.additional_details: Newcastle City Council is a labour council of 50 alluded by 20 Lib Dem counsellors who just get voted in and do nothing for this area. Three Lib Dem candidates have no reason to be Democratic in Gosforth

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local road improvements are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastics in the UK, akin to laws passed in other countries.
attributes.background: At a time when global warming and massive pollution are becoming more pressing issues, more needs to change. A ban on the sale of single use plastics, such as utensils, straws, cup lids, single use plastic bottles and more, could have a big impact on this.
attributes.additional_details: 4.8-12.7 million tonnes of plastic enter the ocean each year https://www.nhm.ac.uk/discover/quick-questions/how-much-plastic-is-in-the-ocean.html

rejection.details:
We currently have the following petition open which you might like to sign:

Ban All Single Use Plastics and Plastic Packaging to Save Our Planet
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607466

attributes.action: Create a new residents permit band for electric motorcycles and mopeds in London
attributes.background:
The cost of a residents permit for a fully electric car is £25 per year, for any motorbike it is £60 and there is no option for electric motorbikes. The council are not prepared to change this ‘at this time’. 
https://www.islington.gov.uk/parking/parking-permits/resident-permit-costs-checker
attributes.additional_details:
I’m requesting that all London councils review their motorbike parking charged and set a reasonable tariff for parking a fully electric motorbike or moped, relative to the electric car charge.

Electric motorbikes are becoming more common and should be accommodated for like all other electric vehicles, they reduce pollution and congestion on our roads and it shouldn’t be prohibitively expensive to park one outside your home.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

Decisions on the cost of parking permits, and whether to review the cost of permits for electric motorcycles, are a matter for local councils, not the UK Government.

attributes.action: Legislate to fine water companies for dumping raw sewage in our waterways.
attributes.background: Legislate to fine water companies for dumping raw sewage in our waterways on a par with the EU. It should be done immediately as there is immeasurable damage being done to our ecosystems, fishes, crabs, sea birds and us. We are all interconnected.
attributes.additional_details: Poisoning our own waterways will kill us all eventually. It is dangerous and short-sighted. Already much of the sealife (fishes, crabs and lobsters and sea-birds) around the UK are being decimated. It is impossible to swim in the sea and rivers in some places, because of the sewage and of course, this will impact on the livelihood of those living by the sea and rivers which are being polluted.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599873

attributes.action: Allow call to prayer from the mosques
attributes.background: We would like the adhan  call to prayer loud from mosques . Even just the day time prayers .
attributes.additional_details: Other countries allow the call to prayer aloud why not our country I am a female British Muslim and I believe this would be an extremely good thing to do even if it’s just the day time prayers therefore it is not noise pollution or disturbing people at night .

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for local councils

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Reduce or remove VAT on the supply, rental & repair of bicycles, inc. e-bikes.
attributes.background: Follow suit with the EU and reduce (or even remove) VAT on the supply, rental and repair of bicycles, including e-bikes. This will encourage more people to cycle and thus reduce carbon emissions, which in turn will improve life in our country and on our planet.
attributes.additional_details: Follow suit with the EU and reduce (or even remove) VAT on the supply, rental and repair of bicycles, including e-bikes. This will encourage more people to cycle and thus reduce carbon emissions, and improve life in our country and on our planet. More movement, less pollution, better health for all. More info at https://www.ecf.com/news-and-events/news/cycling-organisations-achieve-important-victory-eu-consumers-reduced-vat-soon

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603540

attributes.action: Stop Councils creating blanket 20mph Zones.
attributes.background: Stop councils creating blanket 20mph zones restrict zones to roads within 500metres of schools and known accident blackspots.
attributes.additional_details:
Turning major roads into blanket 20mph Zones causes more pollution and traffic jams delaying people in their every day lives.
I recently drove on a duel carridgeway which there is absolutely no justification for in making it a 20mph Zone.
The argument that it is safer for pedestrians absolves pedestrians of all responsibility for their actions when crossing roads. Why not return to a man with a red flag walking infront of vehices at 4mph even safer

rejection.details:
Decisions about speed limits are a matter for the relevant highway authority, not the Government or Parliament.

If you are concerned about speed limits in your area you could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to amend the powers highway authorities have to vary speed limits, but it would need to be clear what changes you wanted to be made to these powers.

attributes.action: E-scooter that goes 15 to 18mph should be allowed on the road just like e-bikes
attributes.background: E-scooter have to be allowed on the road just like e-bike and bike and all rides most wear helmet. Not everyone want to cycle to work and be all sweaty. E-scooter is eco-friendly and help reduce pollution. All others country’s allowed e-scooter, why UK always have to be the one to make silly laws.
attributes.additional_details: E-bikes speed goes up to 45km/h (28 mph) even faster then lots of e-scooters, yet e-bike is allowed on the with no tax and insurance to pay, the police using public taxes paid money to waste they time on stopping people on e-scooter using it to go to work, and they take the scooter and resell it on auction, surely a human being living in UK going to buy that again. This is a big waste of our tax money, there are real crimes out there to Focus on. More people died on bike then on e-scooter.

rejection.details:
e-Bikes are limited to 15mph.  You can read more here:

https://www.gov.uk/electric-bike-rules

attributes.action: Set legal noise levels in Decibel across all UK Pubs and Restaurants
attributes.background:
We are an award winning Pub / Restaurant, after one terrible year, we have amazing kickstarter month and all mainly due to Live Music performed in our garden.

Now have received numbers of complaints regarding noise pollution, however there is now legal limit for noise in decibel!
attributes.additional_details:
I want The Government to set a legal noise limit in decibel per each Pub / Restaurant. I understand every pub location in the UK is different, so legal level of noise should be set by the postcode.

Even Council doesn't know what is legal music level, so how they could justify if music is too loud?

In worst case scenario, if we would loose our music license, we would need to reduce numbers of staff from 27 to at least 10 and stop running live music events which were including also celebrities.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the lack of specific legal limits on noise levels from hospitality venues, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Your petition refers to setting legal limits, but then said these could vary by postcode, in which case it would be likely such limits would be set by local authorities, rather than central government.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling on the Government to set specific noise limits for all hospitality venues, or to require local authorities to set noise limits for all hospitality venues in their area.

attributes.action: Say NO to the application for another place of worship in Hainault
attributes.background:
There is a proposal to the Council for a new place of worship on the industrial estate in Hainault.

Here in Hainault we are very well cultured on our religious beliefs and we are catered for with a variety of places of worship for most religions, already in the area. There is no need for another.
attributes.additional_details: The residents living on joining roads to the industrial estate will suffer from noise pollution, traffic pollution and congestion causing toxic air pollution. There is a local school near by and this is an accident waiting to happen as it will be used as a short cut to the industrial estate. That particular part of the industrial estate is rather busy with lorries, it will cause meyhem for the local residents living here. The agent and the applicant on the proposed plans are not local residents.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for your local authority, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://www.redbridge.gov.uk/about-the-council/petitions/

attributes.action: Ban the extraction and use of peat in the UK
attributes.background:
Peat grows so slowly that it's essentially non-renewable.

It's a really important carbon sink, but it's used as heating fuel, which produces pollution and CO2.

It's used in gardening, but renewable and byproduct alternatives are available.

Outlaw peat extraction and use in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
When the selling and burning of wet wood is outlawed, as happened in England recently, people switch to burning peat among other things: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/sep/27/pollutionwatch-wood-and-peat-burning-brings-return-of-air-pollution-to-dublin

Peatlands are the largest natural terrestrial carbon store, and damaged peatlands are a major source of greenhouse gas emissions: https://www.iucn.org/resources/issues-briefs/peatlands-and-climate-change

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Ban the use of peat in horticulture and all growing media by 2023.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562054

Ban all extraction of peat for horticulture by 2022.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581532

attributes.action: Ban Sport Utility Vehicles (SUVs) from our towns and cities
attributes.background: Restrict the use of SUVs in towns and cities, especially in the main centres and residential areas. Enforce a maximum length and width for vehicles parking on narrow streets and in tight car parks. Allow necessary exemptions for commercial vehicles and those specially adapted for access.
attributes.additional_details:
This recent report from the New Weather Institute https://bit.ly/3uLtTqP shows that the places where SUVs dominate are also where road space is most scarce. Large SUVs are too big for a standard UK parking space, and are some of the most polluting vehicles in terms of air quality and carbon emissions.

SUVs are unsafe. They encourage aggressive driving, and their drivers have less visibility of other road users - particularly children, who may be less tall than the front of the vehicle.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a decision for individual local authorities.

attributes.action: Impose safety restrictions on Chelsea Bridge
attributes.background:
1. Introduce speed cameras on Chelsea bridge 
2. Red line on both sides of bridge to restrict parking at all times
3. Impose fines for motorbikes and cars revving and parking on the Chelsea bridge and on the pavement.
4. Cameras to detect and fine illegal uturns on Chelsea bridge
attributes.additional_details:
Every single weekend there are hundreds of cars and motorbikes parking, speeding, revving engines, doing illegal uturns, driving on the pavement, on Chelsea Bridge.

There is a huge amount of noise and air pollution caused from the cars and even some cars blowing fire from their cars. There is massive disruption to quality of life and sleep to neighbouring residents, and this behaviour places danger to other drivers, and pedestrians from the speed racers and illegal u turns on the bridge.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for Transport for London.

attributes.action: Turn a third of UK coastal seas into fully protected areas for fish population.
attributes.background:
David Attenborough in One Planet, Coastal Seas (Netflix Series) said: 

“We have far too few marine sanctuaries. We need to turn a third of all our coastal seas into properly protected areas, if we do that, our fishing grounds would recover and help sustain both humanity and the natural world.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK currently has 24% of coastal areas under some form of protection but commercial fishing is sometimes still allowed in these areas. We need to beef that up to 33% and make them fully protected. 

Also recent seaspiracy on Netflix brings to light plastic pollution is over 50‰ down to fishing vessels leaving plastic nets in the ocean which kill far more animals than straws and they make lots of money from this.

https://www.wwf.org.uk/what-we-do/projects/protecting-uk-seas 

So let's do it!

rejection.details:
Ban fishing on a third of UK coastal for fish repopulation
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553334

attributes.action: Give more protection and help to victims of neighbourly harassment and abuse.
attributes.background:
With reference to the Human Rights Act which states that people are entitled to the peaceful enjoyment of their property. 
During lockdown, neighbourly disputes have had an even greater impact on mental health. We feel that the local authorities do not do enough to protect or assist victims.
attributes.additional_details:
To reinforce the human rights act and to remind the councils and police of their duties to residents. 
People are suffering intolerable noise nuisance, air pollution, threats to their property and personal safety, harassment, victimisation, mental torture and some are in fear for their lives. 
Many people have been forced to work from home and are finding it difficult because of thoughtless neighbours. 
We need to feel that we have somewhere to turn to and confident we will be listened to.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. However, we can only accept petitions on issues the Government or Parliament are responsible for. Enforcement of existing legal protections relating to nuisance, threats and harassment is a matter for the police, not the Government or Parliament.

If you think that a crime has been committed, you should contact the police here:
https://www.police.uk/contact/

attributes.action: Overfishing and dumping of fish nets is destroying the planet and this must stop
attributes.background: The government should introduce laws to limit fishing and pressure other countries to do the same. There is no accountability for the illegal overfishing. Fishing corporations are getting away with dumping nets and damaging the Ocean. New measures should be introduced to track and stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Dumping of fish nets and fishing equipment is responsible for over 50% of pollution in the ocean and politicians are protecting these corporations and enabling the destruction of Earth. Climate change will be accelerated if overfishing continues and something must be done to change this.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you'd like to tackle overfishing, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like to do to limit fishing. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Change the current UK national rod fishing Byelaws
attributes.background:
Protect the futures of course species including  pike, perch, carp and grayling by making 'taking' course fish species illegal.

A full investigation into the current fish stocks in the United kingdom's river systems, trend data and then reform of the current byelaws to protect all species.
attributes.additional_details:
Current legislations/byelaws dictate: Each day, you can take up to 15 coarse fish. This legislation is out of date and requires immediate reform!
Fish species across the Uk face a number of threats which can be directly linked to human activities such as over fishing, pollution and poaching. Taking fish species for the table need not be another threat to the long term sustainability of our river ecosystems.
The message needs to be clear, concise and understandable by all,
Catch, release, repeat!

rejection.details:
You may like to sign this petition that we currently have open:

Review freshwater rod fishing bylaws reduce daily limit of course fish taken.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570198

attributes.action:
Remove planters from Levenshulme.
We need traffic calming bot Road blockages.
attributes.background:
Remove the planters. We had many consultations about these road blocks which we all opposed yet theyve still been put in place.
Your are forcing more traffic pollution to other roads already crippled by heavy traffic flow.
We shouldn't be encouraging children to play in a road.
attributes.additional_details:
Act on behalf on your constituents and listen to us the residents whom are barricaded in an already heavy traffic flow area.

Our emergency services cant get to where they need to be.

This is a fine example of wasting the public purse.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Ban the placing of an industrial incinerator near where I live
attributes.background: To stop the go ahead of an industrial incinerator near residential properties.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a major health concern regarding this due to a significant rise in childhood asthma and deaths.
As well as the pollution it will cause it will also affect property prices in the area.
This has to be stopped.

rejection.details:
This is a matter for the relevant waste authority, which is likely to be your local county council: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/waste.

You might therefore like to contact your local councillor(s) and ask them to act on your behalf. Your local authority appears to be Oldham Council, and you can find out their contact details here: https://www.oldham.gov.uk/contact.

attributes.action: removal of bus and cycle lanes
attributes.background: Since the implementation of the bus and cycle lanes throughout Greenwich traffic has increased significantly causing higher pollution levels which in turn is detrimental to local residents health .prior to the scheme traffic levels were already high around the woolwich ferry and Charlton areas.
attributes.additional_details: As representatives of the people it is your duty to ensure their safety and well being which this scheme does not .

rejection.details:
Decisions about local bus and cycle lanes are a matter for individual traffic authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition the London Assembly directly. Find out how to petition the Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

attributes.action: Consider CO2 neutral biofuels like Biomethane & E12-E85 in the Green policy.
attributes.background:
UK Trucks run on Biomethane now so why not cars & vans?
Pass law allowing other fuels such as CO2 neutral/negative Biomethane to be used in cars/vans after 2030 as EVs are heavy, expensive & chargers for 40m+ cars in every street is unrealistic. There should be fuel competition not a monopoly!
attributes.additional_details:
Making EVs  CO2
Grid not CO2 neutral
EVs slow charge/low range
Fast charge lower battery life & fires
EV tyres wear faster more tyre dust/road damage
Charge cables ran into streets/paths
Street chargers vandalised/fought over
EVs silent - more accidents
EV hacking
Biofuels use current infrastructure
Rebuilt engine cheaper than replacing batteries
Kids mine Cobalt in the Congo
EVs sterile & unexciting Biofuels to save UK motorsport jobs
Biodiversity
Biofuel from waste lowers CO2 & other pollution

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. We could accept a petition calling for the Government to exclude biofuel from the proposed 2030 ban on new diesel and petrol cars.

attributes.action:
STOP the proposed ban on New Petrol & Diesel Cars by 2030
Consider Alternatives
attributes.background:
Diesel & Petrol cars have equal environmental footprint as an EV through carbon and pollution in mining the elements for the battery as well as manufacturing. The carbon footprint is merely shifting to vehicle manufacturing.

Bringing this forward to 2030 is unrealistic & expensive to consumers
attributes.additional_details:
Explore & Consider alternative fuelling options for a range of current combustion and hybrid engines while continuing to build the infrastructure towards the original 2040 target date. (originally 2050)

Understand the effects on the existing vehicles in circulation and give a better understanding of how taxation, vat and charging will be levied against the consumer.

Clearly set out expectations & infrastructure for existing petrol & diesel vehicles as not everyone will want to drive electric

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556842

attributes.action: Remove the newly installed unnecessary bus lanes in Charlton and Woolwich
attributes.background: The recent installation of the at all time bus lanes on the A206 (SE London) have increased congestion levels significantly. As a result there are vehicles queuing all day on this long stretch of the road causing unnecessary congestion, pollution as well as affecting the mental health of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe this is a miscalculated move made by Greenwich Council as the situation has in no way improved air quality but has created dangerous levels of pollution.

We hope this petition will help bring to focus the situation we face in the area and for it to be reassessed and reversed so that Greenwich Council are using the TfL Cycleway 4 funding correctly by installing cycle lanes and not bus lanes.

A petition made on Change.org with over 2000 supports. Our local MP is not willing to help.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for TfL and the local authorities.

attributes.action: Reduce The Amount Of Plastic Pollution In Essex
attributes.background: In Essex I have noticed that there is a lot of litter around where I live, specifically plastic bottles and single-use plastics. Having a bigger litter picking team or more bins placed in different towns can help a lot in saving the look and status of our county, and helping Earth.
attributes.additional_details: plastic pollution is a big problem because it harms/kills seabirds and marine life, like the fish we eat and it is growing to more and more of a problem, because more and more people are complaining about the plastics they find in their food. Plastics that float into the ocean are being accumulated together by ocean currents. Starting this change in a county like ours may boost other county's into doing the same and saving our world one plastic at a time.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.
	
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can petition Essex County Council directly here: https://www.essex.gov.uk/get-involved/petitions

We have published a number of related petitions, which you might like to sign:

Establish a national waste plastic collection/recycling programme for England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553651

Implement a Deposit Return Scheme for glass and plastic in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550260

attributes.action: Limit firework use for the sake of animals and air pollution
attributes.background: I think there should be a law whereby there is a day and time limit that private households can let off fireworks in urban areas for celebrations such as Bonfire night or New Year's Eve or even limit fireworks to public displays only.
attributes.additional_details: Our pets and other animals go through extreme stress for days during these celebrations especially as they are unaware when they will happen and how many days for and we as owners do not know when to give them calming therapies.  Also,  fireworks have an impact on air pollution and so would help the environment for the future.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Make it illegal for fireworks to be set off on days other than Nov 5 and Dec 31: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559397

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of fireworks to the public
attributes.background: Stop shops from selling fireworks to the public. Only allow organised events/companies/councils to use them at key events such as new year and Bonfire night.
attributes.additional_details: They cause unnecessary stress and trauma on pets and livestock. They cause pollution and litter and can be considered dangerous in the wrong hands. This is an unregulated product where anyone over the age of 18 can purchase them. If used incorrectly they can start fires and bring danger to the lives of others, which in turn puts further strain on the NHS and fire services. They are not essential in this country and cause a lot of people unnecessary stress each year.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

attributes.action: Neighbor nuisances to be treated as harrasment by the police.
attributes.background:
The police take on all areas of neighbour anti-social behaviour. 
Where noise nuisance is concerned it should not have to be above a certain decibel level before it is considered a nuisance, bearing in mind people with autism and other mental health issues can be distressed by sound.
attributes.additional_details:
To take any noise and light pollution investigations off the council environmental health department and place it under an investigation of anti-social behavior.
As a victim of a "Neighbour from Hell" and repeatedly reporting anti-
Social behavior only to be ignored and dismissed as a clash of personalities by the police. The implications of mental health have been immense. to give us a voice and give repercussions to the offender. covid lockdown is exacerbating the issue.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the police and the courts. 

You could start a petition calling for noise nuisance to be made a specific criminal offence, to enable the police to deal with specific cases, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Introduce biodegradable cigarette filter tips for sale in all uk supermarkets
attributes.background: Plastic filter tips are one of the largest contributors to litter and pollution on land and in the oceans. They take decades to break down, therefore once in the environment they cause issues for many years. This is why the government must ensure the provision of more eco-friendly alternatives.
attributes.additional_details: Cigarette filter tips are ubiquitous both in urban and coastal environments, they are the most common form of litter found during beach clean ups, with about 4 TRILLION being discarded into the environment globally each year. Once in the environment these filters cause harm such as degrading habitats through the leaching of harmful toxins or the deaths of organisms through ingestion. therefore it is important there is greater accessibility to biodegradable alternatives.

rejection.details:
Deciding whether to stock biodegradable filter tips is a matter for individual retailers, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban plastic cigarette filters: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330424

Require products containing plastic to be clearly labelled: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550136

attributes.action: Help us remove the HGV’s through Chipping Norton causing dangerous pollution.
attributes.background:
Debate the failure to deliver improvements in line with the AQMA (Air Quality Management) requirements change the route of HGV’S, in Chipping Norton and encourage more electric vehicles(provide more charging posts for EVs). 
Ask for a full debate to create an alternative route for HGV’s.
attributes.additional_details: This issue has remained for more than 10 years and no council had made the decision to improve the level of pollution in Chipping Norton which are now at dangerous levels.

rejection.details:
Decisions about local road restrictions and air quality measures are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the Government or House of Commons.

You can petition West Oxfordshire District Council here: https://cmis.westoxon.gov.uk/cmis/ePetitions.aspx

attributes.action: To revoke the current road closures in Croydon and Crystal Palace
attributes.background: Reverse Croydon Council road closures that trap residents in their own neighbourhoods and funnels unacceptable amounts of traffic through a few roads in the local area. This increases congestion, pollution and extends journey times, prevents  access to ambulances and other emergency vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: Croydon Council held no public consultation with local residents, instead using COVID legislation as a front to force changes onto the local residents that negatively impacts on their quality of life and instead of making our streets safer and more cycle-friendly has done the exact opposite. Emergency vehicles cannot reach residents by the most direct route but instead have to travel long distances around obstacles wasting precious response time. These changes are unwanted and unwarranted.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of Croydon Council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Introduce a Product Redundancy Tax.
attributes.background: On the principle that the ‘Polluter Pays’ introduce a product redundancy tax based on how repairable a product is and how much of the packaging is recyclable.
attributes.additional_details: To encourage industry to think about the environmental effects of their products and packaging and to discourage development of designed in obsolescence.  For example, if a product is disposable then add a 100% Tax to the cost price. If 50% then 50% tax and so on. All tax raised to be used to subsidise Local authority costs of collection and disposal of waste.

attributes.action: Stop clocks going back on Sunday, 25 October 2020
attributes.background: The European Parliament has voted to stop moving clocks forward an hour in spring and back again in the autumn. Politicians passed the measure by 410 votes to 192 - meaning seasonal time shifts, which were introduced during World War One to save energy, will end in 2020

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local planning issues are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Calling-in a planning decision

Once an application is made for the development to take place, all local residents have the right to request that a planning application be ‘called in’ by the Department for Housing, Communities and Local Government. This means that it will assess the planning application against certain criteria and decide if a full inquiry is needed. For more information, including the criteria and how to request the call in of a planning application, see:
 
http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN00930/SN00930.pdf 

You could also contact your local MP, who may wish to request the decision is called in if they agree with you. You can use this page to find out who your local MP is and how to contact them:
 
http://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/ 


If you want the UK Government or Parliament to take action, for example to amend the legislation and policy framework which governs planning and development decisions taken by local authorities, you could start a new petition specifically asking for that action.

attributes.action: Reduce motorcar and motorcycle noise and emissions.
attributes.background:
Amend Section 3 of the Road Traffic Act 1988,to include
"It shall be an offence under this section to drive any vehicle on any public road or other public place in any condition or in any manner likely to cause a nuisance of any kind to any other person whether or not that person is a road user ".
attributes.additional_details: Nationally, hundreds of thousands of citizens are suffering stress and ill-health due to increased vehicle noise and emissions, which they feel helpless to avoid and Police are powerless to prevent. Much noise and pollution is caused by a few individuals altering their vehicles for their own gratification. The law needs to be changed to deter the selfish minority dominating the majority. The amendment is easy to understand and to enforce. The Penalties are proportionate and necessary.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about noise and emissions from cars and motorbikes, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do about this.

The title of your petition refers to noise and emissions, but your petition text calls for a new offence for driving a vehicle in any way which could cause a nuisance to another person, which would have a much wider effect.

There are already vehicle noise limits, and it is already illegal to modify the exhaust system to make a vehicle noisier after it has been ‘type approved’: https://www.gov.uk/noise-pollution-road-train-plane

Taking action in respect of breaches of these rules is a matter for the police.

We have published the following related petitions, which you might like to sign:

Reduce the maximum legal noise limit for motorbikes: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321103

Introduce a ban on sales of new petrol and diesel cars by 2025 in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325512

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to reduce noise limits for all vehicles, or to reduce the allowable level of emissions from all vehicles, but it would need to be clear exactly what action you want the Government to take.

You could start a petition calling for the Government to provide funding for a new bridge, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Allow teachers to access salary sacrifice schemes for electric cars
attributes.background: State-employed teachers are currently exempt from accessing salary sacrifice schemes for electric cars, unlike many other state-employed people. Teachers should be allowed to take advantage of this to contribute to a greener future and savings on purchasing a zero emissions vehicle.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing teachers this will bring them into line with other state-employed personnel; it will help remove more polluting vehicles from the road; it will help to contribute towards the government’s stated target of stopping the production of fossil fuel powered cars by 2035; it will allow teachers to drive to school without emitting harmful gases in the vicinity of the school and other buildings.

rejection.details: The use of salary sacrifice is a decision for individual employers, in this case individual schools, not the UK Government of Parliament. You could start a new petition asking the UK Government to introduce rebates and tax refunds for people who use electric cars, if that's what you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Suspend all tolls because of the COVID19 crisis
attributes.background:
The Government should suspend all road tolls, river crossing tolls and 'congestion charges' for at least 12 months because of the Coronavirus COCVD19 epidemic. 
Where this needs additional powers then they should be sought from Parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Tolls are unfair and arbitrary in where and how they are applied. They are an inefficient way of charging for the use of roads and can increase congestion and pollution. 

2. In the current crisis it is important to give the economy some relief and this can be done at a relatively low cost by suspending tolls. This has already happened in China.

3. A lot of people that the UK need to carry on working are increasingly likely to have to travel to work by their own transport.

4. Many tolls are wholly or partly cash tolls. There is a relatively high risk of spreading disease because there is a quick turn around of the cash.

rejection.details:
The setting of bridge and road tolls, and congestion charges, is the responsibility of local authorities in most cases and private owners in others, not the UK Government or Parliament.
